intro: Dendroconche ampla, commonly known as the broadleaf tree of the Caribbean, is a tropical plant native to the Greater Antilles. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces elongated, woody fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and lowland forests. Dendroconche ampla plays an important ecological role in providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
